name: Fanoosh - Burgers & Bites
address: 1226 Museum Square Dr #100, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: Good burgers. They have a nice spice flavor to them. The buns and fries were great too. We enjoyed our visit :)

Great service. The Rancor burger was cooked perfectly, the caramelized onions were excellent, bacon crisp but not burnt. The Chicken Biryani has a great flavor that you wouldn't expect from fast casual. The seasoned fries are a must.

Very tasty food. Got the double burger ( can’t remember the official name on the menu) but it was amazing. Beef was cooked to perfection and the seasoned fries were just as good. Slightly on the pricier side, just a heads up!

Nice place and clean. Good service and smiling  faces.
The BURGER was hot & delicious. It taste like a kabob. My family liked it very much.

Terrible experience. I heard a lot about this place. Had my expectations held up and crashed into pieces.  
  Burger is just meh. Buns weren't even toasted. Come on now! The sauce that makes the difference, but honestly there's ways more better places. 
 Got the philly fries, big mistake.  All soft and soggy. And there was no chili, just a few chunks of beef patty 🙄 and really little on the sauce.  That was $9?! And for goodness,  $1 for extra sauces! Ridiculous! 
  The wings were just fried chicken and poured flavored sauce on it. Ordered a chicken taco, the lady said: "No, too spicy!" I mean, I I guess..
  Overall, ✋🚫

name: Shahi Darbar
address: 12920 University Blvd Suite 100, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: Wonderfully equipped menus sporting a wide variety of authentic options for everyone. The restaurant has lots of big widows which bath diners in sunlight, and it's extremely clean. Can't wait to come back soon
Good food, great service.
I highly recommend this place. Fantastic food and great service! My personal favorite is the Karahi chicken - it’s phenomenal.
Ordered the beef bihari and chicken Malai boti. Good price for both and they tasted excellent!  Juicy and perfect level of spice. Butter naan was huge.

One of the best chicken charga (real Pakistani style) and pishawri chicken We ever had. It’s very clean and different than any other Pakistani/Indian restaurant. Food was amazing and price were reasonable.  Must visit this place, you won’t be disappointed

name: Mr.Donut & Kolaches
address: 1226 Museum Square Dr #558, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews:
Good stuff. Nice to finally have another place to get Breakfast;)
And now I  just reached  level 6 :D
The best kolachesin the area and kind attention in front desk

Glaze , Sprinkle & Chocolate, Donuts Holes, Cake , Apple Fritter , Muffins , Cream Cheese, Maple Bacon, Filling, (DONUTS)/  Halal beff , Halal Sausage & Cheese Beef , Halal Chicken & Cheese , Beef , Ham&Cheese , sausage&Cheese ,Sausage no cheese , Spicy Sausage&Cheese ,Boudin , Bacon Egg&Cheese , Sausage egg & cheese , Buffalo Chicken & cheese,  Potatoes egg & cheese (KOLACHES) /   Slovachek Sausage Garlic Peper Jack , Chicken Fetta Cheese , Spinach Fetta Cheese , Sausage & Cheese , Ham & Cheese Roll, Bacon Egg& Cheese , Sausage Egg&Cheese,  just egg & cheese (CROISANT)/  Potatoes Egg&Cheese, Bacon egg & cheese , Sausage egg & Cheese , just Egg&Cheese ( Break fast TACO).....

Went here because we happen to drive by and OMG best decision ever!! Most donut shops around here you dont remember all taste same not this place its amazing!!! So good not close to my house but I will make the drive even tho I got a shipley up the street from me they are way better!

I had the cinnamon roll but it didn't have any cinnamon!  It was just a sweet roll.  As a sweet roll,  it was good...tender and not overly sweet.  Since I was told it's a cinnamon roll, I was expecting cinnamon.

name: Dinners4me
address: 16305 Kensington Dr #150, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA

name: Madras Pavilion
address: 16260 Kensington Dr suite a, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews:
Sreejith was the waiter. He was awesome 👏 
Great food. Great recommendations. Superb service!  Will come again for sure!

This place used to be very nice. The building still looks very grand. The food was horrible and the service was even worst. The person who received us was the hostess, waiter, chef and cashier. We were the third customer in a hall that could probably seat and couple hundred people. The  food was horrible. The dahi-baday tasted as if made in lemon. The fish was ok but the somosa was petrified. Burnt and hard rock. The filling had a weird smell. All the eateries in the surrounding area had a waiting and after we ate here it was obvious why this place was deserted. Bad bad management.
I went for a party here , there food was very delicious. I even told me American friends to there and eat . Customer service is awesome. Thanks
Excellent hospitality, delicious vegetarian food,nice atmosphere..many more positive things to say. I will definitely recommend this place. A big cheer to Rajan sir ,Srijit and team!
Been there for a party. Fairly good resturant

name: Ichiban Sushi & Tapioca
address: 16200 Kensington Dr, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: I went to lunch with my wife.The place is very cute and cozy a little mum and pup type of place. They prepare food in front of you to me that is a big plus. Sushi was amazing and fresh one of the best that I ever had. The Tapioca tea was also good and kind of different. I had a lunch box and it was a lot of food my wife had a sushi plate and fry rice with shrimp. The staff was nice and welcoming.

Excellent food and service from Ichiban. We got the Houston roll, Texas Ranger roll, and the Lisa roll, and all were delicious. The atmosphere and aesthetic is wonderful and everyone is super friendly. I definitely look forward to coming back here in the future!

This is one of the better sushi restaurants in the area. The sushi is good, and the customer service is top notch.  Our waitress was very attentive and checked on us regularly to make sure our needs were met. I eat here every chance I get.
Great food and service. A little pricey but they're worth it

Recommend shaggy dog, Hawaiian roll and spicy edamame. All were really good. Best shaggy dog I’ve had, and we get shaggy dog everywhere we go. Great customer service and good prices for the big rolls. We were full by the time we finished

name: Pho Mai Vietnamese Noodle House - Sugar Land
address: 16200 Kensington Dr Ste 100, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: This place is convenient as it is walking distance from my office. Usually stop in for a quick, cheap and tasty charcoal beef Bahn Mi sandwich.

Easily the best pho in Sugar Land and possibly all of Houston. 

The service is always excellent too. I highly recommend the vermicelli and veggie spring rolls.

I've been coming here for 11 years and have never had a bad experience.
Got Pho Ga white/dark meat to go.  Solid.  Paid a little over $8 for a large.  Wonderful taste and service.  No nonsense Pho place here.  Also serves milk tea.
Have tried many of their pho dishes, all taste great. Their vermicelli bowls are delicious too. My coworkers and I enjoy eating here. Prices are very reasonable as well.
I had the beef pho.  The meat was tender and the broth was very flavorful. What can say, it was great.

name: Nirmanz Food Boutique
address: 16338 Kensington Dr Suite #160, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: Quality of food has gone down. I loved this place. It was good, when Nirmanz was directly responsible for food cooked there. Of late, I am seeing his brother taking charge, and it has been downhill since then. Recently I ordered bhel, they just mixed dry ingredients and gave it. No veggies, no spicy/sweet sauce, nothing (see photo). Hope Nirmanz will take control of his restaurant again. Else, another Indian restaurant bites dust.

place was good and we had some waiting time.. what was not good ,was food that we ordered. We ordered , goat vindaloo and it was a disaster.. What it came and what we ate was like Goat tomato.. a tomato curry with 4 to 5 pieces of goat meat.. quantity was also not much and surely it's not worth a price. I didn't dare to order anything else but left half of our food there and went somewhere else...   Guys, work on the price,quantity and quality as well..  If this kind of food is continued then it wont take long for people to change their preferences for restaurant... Good luck.. Definitely, not going back.
Just so flavorful .  The hot appetizers were great.  Service is outstanding and fast.  What a great little place.

Great place for authentic Indian food - north, south, vegetarian, Portuguese inspired - it doesn't matter! Kool and Kitschy   decor with attentive staff. Small bites available. Multi spice levels offered. Samples are even given, if you ask. We will be returning again for sure - many things to check off the menu :)
I tried Gujarathi thali and taste was awsm! Quantity of curries need to be increased.

name: Dan Fender Auto Sales
address: 16200 Kensington Dr, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA

name: Indian Summer
address: 16260 Kensington Dr suite b, Sugar Land, TX 77478, USA
reviews: I love this place. Very nice ambiance with good food and most importantly “Halal” food.
Excellent Food, great quality and taste... to me, this place is so far best for Indian food in Houston area... would certainly re-visit ...

This used to be Madras Pavilion. Any Desi in the area has probably been here a few times. They have opened a new concept, and remodeled the restaurant. Their fusion items are good and their new cocktails were really tasty. I would highly recommend!

* For Vegetarians*

Newly renovated (previously Madsras Pavilion), the place is bright and spacious. Menu is innovative. We ordered the jackfruit curry and kofta. Jackfruit tastes a bit weird so know what you are getting into. Both were amazing... Overall best North Indian food we have had in Houston.

I was invited to their soft opening today, and I must say that the food was delicious! The menu is different and not typical like other Indian restaurants. The service was great and it is an awesome place to bring the entire family! Don't miss this new gem!

name: Patel Brothers
address: 16338 Kensington Dr Unit#130, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: Well stocked but prices are high.

name: Perry's Steakhouse & Grille
address: 2115 Town Square Pl, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews:
Great food, service and decor. While visiting family we had to do the Friday lunch at Perry's. The food is always superb and the service is terrific too. 
Everyone went with the pork chop. It's a huge and flavorful double cut that will be enough for lunch and dinner. 
Plenty of other steakhouse choices too.

We had reservations and were seated fairly quickly in a nice little room off of the busy main dining area. It was quieter and we could easily converse. 

We chose Friday lunch for their famous pork chop that is offered in a lunch portion on Fridays only. The smaller version of their 7-finger (high) roasted pork chop is served with mashed potatoes and house-made applesauce. 

My husband ordered that with creamed spinach and I ordered the salmon, served with mashed potatoes and assorted vegetables. 

I helped him a bit as my salmon was no way near his generous serving. The chop had a very delicious glaze and was tender, though not as tender as it was on our last visit. My salmon was cooked just the way I ordered it, medium with a touch of pink. My vegetables were crisp and plentiful.

This is a lovely location and the server was attentive and friendly. I asked the front desk attendant for a favour and she cheerfully accommodated me with no hesitation. 

We don't come often and feel gently pampered when we do!

We were in the area to see the Illusionists at the Smart Financial Center and wanted a special dinner. We made a 6pm reservation online, valet parked and were sat immediately on arrival. We soon realized after we were sat and ordered drinks and an appetizer that the show was at 7pm and not 8pm so we promptly let our server know and placed our order. She was very accommodating and put a rush on everything. Food and service was amazing, only wish we would have had more time to enjoy the experience. We did make it to the show  with a minute to spare.

Tried it ALL. Everything that comes out of the kitchen will taste good. Sea bass cooked perfectly. Lobster🦞 , steak🥩 , king crab🦀 , pasta🍝 , whipped potatoes, seafood stuffed mushrooms, chops, cheesecake and cocktails🍹 🍸 - IT WAS ALL SCRUMPTIOUS. 

Lights- a little too dim.

A high end steakhouse with daily special. Lucked out on our visit with the sis yak being its house specialty pork chop cut at the table side.  Deliciously prepared, ample portion.  Bacon salad was delicious too.  Would definitely come back.  Friendly service.

name: P.F. Chang's
address: 2120 Lone Star Dr, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: Hadn't been to PF Changs in a minute. This was my 1st time at this location. Service started a little slow but the meal was fresh - when we asked for a hotter sauce suggestion, our waiter came back with the sauce below.  It was a wonderful addition to our meals!!

The food was the same as it always is. Decent. But this time the service was incredibly slow. I think the waiter forgot to put in one of the appetizer orders and then one of our entrees was also 15 minutes later then the rest. They are always super busy so I don't believe it was the new year Eve rush.  Overall it took us over two hours to get out of there. Never again.
My go-to restaurant for interesting Asian food in the Sugar Land area. Never been disappointed going there.

The environment seemed particularly family friendly during my visit. Our server was friendly and interactive, and knew the menu well enough to help us decide our meals. We started off with bowls of warm wonton soup and glasses of refreshing red sangria. For entree, we ordered Chang's chicken with sweet and spicy chilli sauce which was delicious.
Chuck is an awesome bartender! Not only because we have the same name, but because he is so chill and down to earth. If you need something he will be right on it! Great customer service!

name: Panera Bread
address: 1928 Hwy 6, Sugar Land, TX 77478, USA
reviews: I don't know the name of the lady that helped me this morning,  I'm not sure if the name on the receipt is hers, (Mario) but she was very helpful and  patient with me . Last minute,  I had  to purchase veggie sandwiches for 10 people,  and I didn't want to spend too much,  but still wanted good quality. Her suggestion was great.  Everyone loved their sandwich and was very satisfied! I didn't get to tell her thank you before I left because I didn't see her up front.
This is a great place to grab a light lunch. The sandwiches are fresh and healthy and the soups are delicious.

This place is always fantastic; I’m so glad it exists!
Sat outside the last time, as it was a beautiful day, and really enjoyed it! I always order a soup, whether that be tomato soup, broccoli and cheddar, or chicken noodle. Their chips are AMAZING too!

This Panera location ROCKS! My husband and I both got the unlimited coffee deal through Panera Rewards. We order through the app for pick up and it's ready. Yesterday I ordered macaroons and before I could head that way I had a call from the Manager saying they were out of those but could pick something else. Once we got there they let us pick out any 4 pastries since we had already paid in the app. Great attitude and great customer service!! Thank you Jennifer and team!!

This is the worst Panera location. This is my sixth complaint at this location. They have forgot meat in my bowl twice, forgot avocado, added cheese when I said no cheese, no side, and the portions are HORRIBLE!  The worst customer service by far was the manager on duty. He upset me even further by stating they have to measure out all food when i showed him the bowl was practically empty he said other cooks didn’t measure. Every time I visit a different location I have a positive experience and good portions. This one gives child’s size portions with terrible customer service. I wish I would have taken a picture for $11??? I will never ever spend another penny at this location! Even though it’s blocks from my home. Oh forgot to mention it takes forever to order in line no matter what time you go.

name: Becks Prime
address: 1822 Hwy 6, Sugar Land, TX 77478, USA
reviews: Wasn't blown away. The burgers tasted like any other burger out there. The fries were a little greasy.  There's nothing  memorable.  Everything is sold separately . I spent over $17 on just myself which is ridiculous for a burger, fries, and sweet tea. They also don't have fried chicken tenders for children.   I got my son the burger and he took one bite and spit it out.  Lastly, the attitude of the lady taking out order wasn't appropriate and set a negative tone.

They have an absolutely delicious chicken breast that was cooked beautifully! We had veggies with that which were nice, and we set outside near the lake so that our grandsons could run back and forth and watch the ducks in the water! We love the food and it's nice to have a setting where our grandsons can be outside and active! We happened upon a wedding party taking pictures on the Rocks across the lake :-)
Great food and relaxing patio.

The burger is absolutely amazing and alone definitely gets 5 stars. My 4 star rating is because the queso was runny and the chips were stale. Other than that, Becks Prime is a top notch burger joint. The outdoor seating is spacious with lots of shade and a beautiful view of the tranquil lakeside setting. P.S. the parmesan truffle fries are delectable (and the ducks go crazy for them, too)!

My first time here will not be my last.
By far, the best burgers, shakes and fries I've had in many years!
My husband had a 'regular' burger. I treated myself to the Shroom Burger. We also enjoyed an order of fries, a vanilla shake and a Peach shake.
The attention to every detail of my meal was quite evident. Many of the 'burger joints' one goes to have gotten the burger down to a fast science, but here, every sandwich is raised to a high art.
All ingredients were prepared in-house, including the grinding of the Angus beef for the burger patty and the slicing of the cheese.
I was surprised to find that they even bake their own buns in-house daily.
I shall be back to sample many more of the

name: Pei Wei
address: 16101 Kensington Dr, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: This restaurant seems to have changed management staff or ownership.  I used to order from this location often but my order never comes out correct anymore.  They seem to forget the items I bought and give me other items I cannot eat.  I will NOT be ordering from this location any longer.
Sister and I ordered from here and there was a medium sized ROACH in my teriyaki rice bowl. Management reached out but didn’t really seem to actually care. Really disgusting

This used to be the best Pei Wei around. Don't know what happened but it has definitely fallen.  Stopped in tonight to grab a to go order.  Guy behind the counter was having a very loud conversation with a guy in the kitchen area about how many hours they were getting between two locations.  He took my order and went right back to their discussion.  Food came out pretty quick but when I got home I found that the rice was too dry to eat. The chicken was dry with very little sauce and the broccoli tasted like it had fish oil  on it.  Even the fortune cookies were stale. Should have just thrown that $10 in the trash...  so sad another good place down the toilet......looks like I should have read the reviews before stopping in.

Before I get into my review, I want to preface it by saying that I really love PeiWei. That said, this location has gotten oddly bad over the last several visits. This time was the worst, and I have to say it appears to be all about the staff. The young woman that took our order had the attitude that she'd rather be any place else. Out order was messed up (as were the orders of several other customers in the short time we were there.) The place was just dirty. The floors were sticky and most of the tables were dirty. The staff would come and clear the table, but never wiped them down. The area where the tea and fountain drinks are was a mess. The entire place just felt dirty and unkempt. When the food came it was just not the same experience we are used to. My daughters order was just wrong. Mine was a pile of rice and a little bit of beef, and the Kung Pao chicken in my wife's bento box was unbelievably salty...all of which are unusual for the restaurant. I sincerely hope someone from corporate sees this review and pays this location a visit.
The restaurant needed a thorough cleaning. The floors and the tables were sticky. The windows were dirty. It used to a lot nicer before but looks at it lacks maintenance.

name: Zoës Kitchen
address: 2260 Lone Star Dr, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: My favorite place to eat with vegan options. Food is always fresh. Staff is super friendly. I would recommend when food is served to bring silverware out with food as a community area to pick up silverware is a prominent place to spread germs and bacteria. Silverware is stored next to the soda machine on the hallway to and from the men's and women's bathroom. I always ask for to go plastic ware just so I don't have to use silverware from the bin by the bathrooms.

Very clean place! I ordered the chicken kabobs which comes with two sides. I ordered the roasted vegetables and the fruit. It smells delicious and besides, this place never disappoints unless they run out of chocolate cake.

Zoe’s is always a go to healthy option when eating out for me. Their menu items are reasonably priced and there’s something for everybody. On this visit I had the Mediterranean Chicken with the braised white beans and grilled veggies on the side. The grilled veggies included carrots cooked to perfection, yellow onions, purple onions, and mushrooms. Ya girl was in heaven 😜. I got my colorful veggies in, had an ample portion of protein with my water on the side. I’m looking forward to trying one of their new dishes, the cauliflower rice bowl with quinoa.

Also Zoe’s started a rewards program so you can earn points when you eat.
First time here. Food taste, quantity and quality were so good. Can't wait to go back!
The new menu rocks. The old one was great but the variety added in the new menu is simply mouth watering. Dying to try everything on the menu over next few weeks.

name: Piada Italian Street Food
address: 1930 Hwy 6, Sugar Land, TX 77478, USA
reviews:
The Italian fast food restaurant! It’s really fast to get the food 🥘 as it’s prepared in front of you and you can get the food of your choice! We ordered a few things and I would say avocado piada was the best! But I wish the quantity was bit larger than that but the taste was very good! Also we got carbonara and basil pesto pasta 🍝 
It’s nice environment and is a good one so I recon you to come here and enjoy it as well!
Cheers 🥂

This is what I call a fast food Italian pasta place. I'm a huge pasta-lover. The environment is very casual and allows for small talk. The lines clear up quickly. You could build your own pasta and have no limits for toppings. The regular sized bowl is pictured...which could easily make for two meals (which you would feel full both times). I have never tried their drinks, but their water tastes clean and very refreshing. The only downside may be the extra meats that you could add are a little overly salty and have lack of special taste. I used to love their grass-fed meatballs...I'm not sure why they changed it up to be not so tasty.

The place I wanted to go was closed, when we accidentally stumbled upon this place. It was Italian so I did not think anything could go wrong. And I was right. The food was absolutely delicious. We dined inside. The benches were a little uncomfortable after sitting for so long oh, but the food was worth it. They had three different options of how you pick at your food prepared and I recommend there lemonade versus the one from the fountain drink. I recommend anyone looking for good food and good customer service to try Piada Italian Street Food.

I like the concept of fast casual Italian. It was really easy for our group to order and get our food. The portion sizes were ok and overall it's a good deal. The biggest downside was the service. Not a single employee was friendly or welcoming.

Yummo! Husband said he was dieing to take me here and boy, was he right! 

Added cilantro and lemon to my chicken carbonara and it was delicious. Their fresh tea was a great refresher drink for the summer heat. Customer service was at a high. Such a simple concept with fresh ingredients and good ambiance. Highly recommend going here.

name: AGU Ramen Sugar Land
address: 2130 Lone Star Dr, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: It is a delight to take the family to AGU Ramen. The food is delicious and of good size. The staff is really friendly and attentive.

Service was awesome at this Ramen location located in the heart of Sugar Land's City Walk area. Waiters were very friendly and willing to guide us through the different culinary options available. Food was great but there were certain bites where the temperature was off. Almost like it had been heated up and hadn't done so throughout. It was tasty but the temperature difference kinda threw it off. Definitely worth the visit, on the fence about a return though. If you're in the area, it's worth checking out.
Great soup, not salty, the noodle is very chewy, not to soft. Garage next to the restaurant, easy to access. Strongly recommended!

I had high hopes that this could be a regular Sugar Land stop. After reading mixed reviews, decided to give it a try. My husband ordered a couple of appetizers and I went straight for the spicy ramen! He liked his food well enough. My ramen had nice enough heat at #2, but the house-made Thai chili sauce seemed a bit oily. The broth flavor was quite nice. The noodles were not my favorite. The cha-siu was over-cooked and looked dry. When I bite into it, it should hold its shape, not fall apart. The egg had good flavor, but it was firmer than I'm used to eating. The server was very attentive and friendly. Don't know if we'll be back for a second try.

Pretty good Ramen... One of the best in Sugar Land. Would have have it five stars but service was slow, the workers seemed not very concerned and not timely. Nothing crazy... Just not what I expect. Either way, will be back if I'm in the area and want ramen.

name: Baguio Hut Express
address: 16200 Kensington Dr #500, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews:
Ordered Tosilog breakfast plate, was more than enough food and very delicious. 
Left full and pleased. Will be back for breakfast again

Cute little restaurant. simple delicious items that reminds me so much of what my mom used to cook even though we are Vietnamese. the little sour soup had no veggies floating but was awesome and at the perfect temperature for me to consume right away. the sausage was sweet and juicy and very tasty. the chicken was delicious. as for their gulaman drink if you like tapioca drinks, you probably gonna love this Filipino version. it was all clean and there was no music, which is a pleasant change from what i'm used to.
So happy I found this place. I am constantly craving Filipino food during my 12-13 hr shifts and this place is so close to work. Great people, great food and great prices. :)

Food was delicious, but the selection was not too great at 4pm on a Sunday even though the restaurant was open for another 6 hours. There were no egg rolls and not a single pancit diah. There is hia left me a bit puzzled. There  were several meat dishes but none of the delicious vegetable dishes you'd normally find at a turo turo. I'd have given them 5 stars for a better selection.

We used to come here often when craving Filipino food. If they go back to serving hot meals like before, it will once again be very enjoyable to eat here as their style of cooking is very good, almost like delicious home-cooked meals. (I dislike having to eat Bangus that is not hot - eating hot Bangsilog is part of the fun.) I think the all-day breakfast combination deals where you get to choose from about 10 dishes is a really good set up. I love their Tortang Talong (Filipino Eggplant Omelet) and Dinuguan. They also have excellent Turon (Banana Eggroll). And Goldilocks products are available here. Please be better again.

name: Blaze Pizza
address: 16100 Kensington Dr, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: The crust was cooked perfectly. The toppings were a little scant but fresh and tasty. Love the balsamic glaze on top. I love the blood orange lemonade. Service was good. Wish there were plates to share your pizza with. The patio overlooks a very pretty view with a lake and ducks and turtles.

I wish I could leave zero stars. I ordered a pizza from here and they charged my card, but by the time I got there ten minutes later, they said they were closed. I have been fighting them for 2 weeks trying to get a refund for food I never got. Go to Pepperoni's or Pizza 101 instead for better service and they will definitely not steal from you like Blaze Pizza stole from me.

*update* I'll change my review to 2 stars because I FINALLY got not a refund, but at least a pizza out of them after fighting for 2 weeks. I will definitely never come here again though after the customer service nightmare.

They serve customized hot krispy pizzas with lots of choices of meat and vegetables available. There are many seats available outside by a stream with many ducks floating around. It's a nice restaurant with good scenery, and I'll be back again shortly...

I love food & currently I have been on a plant based diet, this is my perfect cheat meal. Cauliflower crust, vegan cheese, all the veggies I want! Delicious 😋😋 edit* they are out of Cauliflower & Keto crust till March but still advertise it! I waited in line for 20 minutes to hear this

Great service and staff.  We asked for high rise and didnt give us high rise dough when they were putting the veggies on and corrected it.  They gave us our whole meal free to our surprise.  Food was fresh tasting and hot.

name: Bar Louie
address: Town Center Blvd N, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: The food is always delicious but the service outside can be a little slow. We don’t mind as we enjoy our nights out but just a heads up. Looks like they added some new things to the menu that looks delicious! The buffalo chicken flatbread is always delicious! We like to order it as an appetizer for everyone and it’s always gone within minutes!
Good burgers. Loaded tots were perfect.
First time guest at Bar Louie.  Service was good, very personable.  Surprised by limited menu.  I guess I shouldn't have been since the word "Bar" is in the name.  Great drink choices however.

Enjoyed our visit to Bar Louis, with one exception. The bartender was convivial and knowledgeable, making great cocktails with good service without being pestering. I quite enjoyed my Manhattan(s).  The exception to the great experience was the presence of persistent fruit flies. I know they are difficult to eradicate, but they were annoying.
It's got KOOL all over it. Kitchen is open till 1am or so. Better than going to ihop for a late meal! Great Cosmo. The service is kinda slow, but great when you have their attention.

name: Changs Chinese Restaurant
address: 16100 Kensington Dr #200, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: Great food and excellent service. New favorite place. We ordered the sizzling chicken, shrimp and asparagus, salt and pepper fish and pork egg foo yung. Everything we ordered was delicious. We will be back to try other items on the menu.
I got Pepper Steak, Beef Lo Mein and Fried Rice which came with the entree. I was very happy with the taste and quality. I’m much more curious about their menu now. I’ll be back soon.

Great little Chinese restaurant. I loved it! I had the chicken fried rice and my wife had the chicken lo mein. The portions were huge, the food was delicious, and the prices were very reasonable. The staff was friendly and attentive. I would definitely recommend this place.
Still open during normal business hours for carryout or delivery through delivery services. Excellent food with good portions.
Chang has the best roasted duck in town. The duck is juicy and tender.  With price at $12.99 for the half duck, you can’t beat that. Strongly recommended.

name: Jupiter Pizza & Waffles Co.
address: 16135 City Walk, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews:
My wife brought me here for a celebratory brunch. The location is perfect as it is situated in a serene, mall with lots of attractions left, right and center.
The wait time is long but they have a neat system which basically allows you get on the queue remotely. It tracks your progression through the queue and notifies you when you’re up.
The service was prompt. We received our food within minutes of placing our orders. We ordered the Southern Belle. It was delicious.
The only drawback for me is that the portions looked little small to me (especially the sweet potato fries).
Overall though, I would highly recommend this spot.

This place is simply delicious. Every-single-thing I've tried I've loved, simple as that. Although the "Angry Rooster" pizza is still my favorite, I keep trying new stuff every time we go there.They have so many and so different really good tasting food to choose from. The place is nice and clean, the atmosphere is super friendly, relaxed and cozy. You always have a nice view of the square. The service is great and doesn't take forever to get your meal as on other pizza shacks around town. And if you think it's costly, you'll be surprised. The place is not that big, so I recommend you get in the waiting list online so you don't wait at all when you arrive. Been a regular there and will be for much much longer.

Absolutely amazing food. Great for comfort brunch and drinks. They gave a selection if comfort food, breakfast, and pizza. Make sure you try the waffles! They serve an impressive selection of beers and great mimosas.

The staff is great and friendly. The atmosphere is casual and trendy. There restaurant is clean. There are outside seating options available. It's located in front of town hall, to the right of the grassy area. 

The ONLY reason I'm not giving 5 stars is due to the wait to get in. I've been here a few times and there's often a wait, especially weekends before 2. Obviously worth the wait because I keep going back.

First, the menu is just really fun to read over: great titles, descriptions, and more. Second, the food was fantastic! Fluffy waffles, syrup and honey, breakfast food you will wish you could have everyday and any day. Third, even what they use to bring a check out was unique! It arrives in paperback book. 🤣 Definitely planning to go back!

Must come visit for lunch! Lunch menu is very reasonable and offers a wide variety of plates that work well to share among friends. All food was delicious and fresh. Excellent place to relax with family and friends and even let the kids run around outside while adults enjoy the meal and a few drinks. Highly recommend this place.

name: Bar Louie
address: 16089 City Walk, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: Menu is limited but everything looked and tasted  good. Our group liked the flat breads, fish and chips and fish tacos. They also have an interesting selection of beers. We're an older group so we typically sit outside where the music isn't quite so loud. Nothing wrong with the music, it's just difficult to talk over and we go there to talk and people watch.

I came to enjoy Fat Tuesday on Feb. 25. Let me say whoever was the Dj did a excellent job keeping everyone in the bar happy, dancing, vibing, and together.💕 The cooks in the back did a wonderful job cooking the new orleans pasta. It was delicious. Last I want to thank the bar tenders for serving up some excellent drinks. We iwill be back for another gathering.

Taryn was absolutely amazing! She was very tentative  and made sure all of our food was accurate. Taryn has a great spirit and an upbeat personality. What a fantastic service and personable experience for my first time at Bar Louie!! :)
Had a good time. I was in early and had some good times. The early bartender was very attentive. Food was great. The place has a open feel to it.

Enjoyed drinks and appetizers. Our waitress Char P had a great sense of humor, she was attentive even though there was a lot of people. She was in a fabulous mood and was kind. Will be back, thanks for the first time experience Char P.

name: Jimmy John's
address: 2276 Lone Star Dr, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: I placed an order online today and requested a delivery time of 12:30. I called around 12:45 to check on my order because the tracking status just kept saying out for delivery. The manager said they were busy and hung up.  My order did not arrive until after 1pm.  He could have offered to waive the delivery fee or offer a discount on my order or a future order, but he acted like this was not a problem.  The sandwich was great, but their customer service needs improvement. Beware when ordering from this location.

I visited this Jimmy John's location, and  l was greeted by a fast freckin' sandwich maker Akber... pardon me if l mispelled your name. 

Akber made my sandwich so fast and it was too damn pretty to eat. By, the way, this location is always clean!  I will continue to get  my JJ sandwich fix here!

#deliciousandfresh
#akberismysandwichguy
#prettysandwich
Food is great however the gentleman working is extremely rude. Looks like Jimmy John's needs to do some customer service training for it's employees. Won't be visiting this location anytime soon.
I've been coming here for a few years and never had any issues. Clean location with very friendly staff. Sandwiches are always delicious.

The sandwich was good but the service was sub-par. I specifically asked for 1:30pm delivery and my sandwich shows up “freaky early “! Plus I asked for driver to call me once arriving, which they did, but couldn’t wait for me to meet them downstairs and left my food with security. I don’t appreciate my food being left with a 3rd party middle man. Please follow instructions!

name: Fish City Grill
address: 15980 City Walk, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews:
#kidfriendly
We visited this for the first time and was pleasantly surprised!  Their hospitality was excellent! The staff brought us samplers of their soups as this was our first time there. They were so thoughtful that they even brought samplers for the kids too! Their kids menu has lots of options and my kids loved the food. Their fried calamari was a super hit with my kids too. I took the fish taco and it had a nice twist in the flavor. I loved the ambience and my kids also enjoyed the place. Will certainly go back again!

This restaurant is exceptional. The menu isn't very complex. I believe this allows them to execute the dishes they do offer with extreme precision. My favorite is by far the Shrimp Po' Boy. It is the best I have had outside of New Orleans. The grilled shrimp is also very good. If you enjoy non-pretentious seafood at a reasonable price this place is for you. Very, very good.

This restaurant was casual and welcoming which I actually liked. And I enjoyed the peach mule and hurricane cocktails which were both good and well made. I would totally recommend the hurricane any day. The crab cakes appetizer paired surprisingly well with the arugula it was served with. My entree was the chipotle shrimp tacos which were tasty and flavorful. I had the chance to taste the fish tacos and thought they were good too.

Tried the char grilled Jack Daniel Pecan  Glazed Scottish Salmon special of the day.   It was good, perfectly cooked, but a little sweet.  Came with mashed potatoes and sauteed asparagus.  For the price I left a little hungry

First time here and I'll be back! I'm a picky fish person and loved the fish sandwich. We also tried your crab cake and hush puppies. Both were devine! The fish is fresh and not too fishy at all. This is now one of my favorite places. Our server, Jenny, was super attentive and patient. I'll ask for her again. Randall checked on us several times and was a joy to talk to. You gave to try this place!

name: The Burning Pear
address: 16090 City Walk, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: A perfect atmosphere for a great drink. I ordered a Bulleit Old Fashioned. Great quality and balance in the drinks. Their food was awesome as well. The Burning Pear is in the lobby of the Marriott.
Full service break fast with chef prepared omelettes and waffles. Buffet includes smoked salmon, turkey and cheese tray. Very expensive though. Nice ambience
Great drinks. Enjoyed my sliders and fries to cushion the alchohol.
Delicious food, would definitely come back
The breakfast buffet was not worth $22. The sausage was cold and the biscuits tasted like they were a couple days old. I have had better breakfast at a free continental breakfast.

name: Salata
address: 2170 Town Square Pl, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews:
My husband and I have our regular date night most of the time at Salata and we are NEVER disappointed. Not only is the food always delicious but the staff is wonderful as well. Joya is usually our server as we typically visit on the same night each week and she is always fantastic, serving with a smile! 

One particular evening the croissants were all out and after checking in the back for some she came out and told us there weren't anymore and it would be about 20 minutes before a new batch was ready. With that, we decided not to have croissants that night. Well, as we were nearing the end of our salads, here comes Joya with fresh hot croissants just for us. She said, "I know you said you didn't want them tonight but I wanted to bring them out to you anyway since they were ready before you finished." She was so sweet and thoughtful to bring them out to us! :-)
Great clean look. friendly staff. Great quality food with tons of options. Overall good value for the prices.

The food is great. The service could be better for sure. I’ve been to this location multiple times where I have to say what I want on a salad 10 times before it gets added to my bowl. This time that didn’t happen. I got 2 salads, one small one large, the small one needed crab in it, and after saying it multiple times very loudly, the crab never got added tot he salad. They didn’t charge me for something they didn’t give me, so that’s fine I suppose, but I would have loved what I asked for.
My favorite salad bar,friendly staff and very clean space .Wide selection of veggies and the ginger lime dressing is the bomb. You can eat in or seat out

This place was had so many options it was crazy, I almost could not choose. You can honestly customize your dream salad...I know I did. It was also super chill and not alot of people were there so my wife and I had a nice time eating and conversing without having to worry about folks next to us.

name: LunchThyme Catering / JOPO
address: 16107 Kensington Dr #394, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA

name: The Toasted Yolk Cafe - Sugar Land
address: 2110 Town Square Pl, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: Nice place that did not have a wait. Service was amazing on a Friday morning. We sat outside and did not have a lack of service. There was a nice crowd but the food came out in timely fashion! The French Toast was really good, as we divided it up just so everyone could get a taste. On top of that they had warm syrup! 😊 I ordered the West Coast Arnold which was a recommendation from my younger brother and I must say it was a GREAT decision! The poached egg was perfect with the generous size bacon slices. We also had a few shots and mimosas to start the morning which were both really good. I think we actually had pineapple mimosas. Prices are definitely high, not a bargain place but the food was exactly what I wanted. 🤷🏾‍♂️

Toasted Yolk Sugar Land - Food was great as usual but I don’t feel they were prepared for a come back from the Covid19.  The servers and staff were not wearing any type of protection such mask or gloves.  They stood very close to the patrons and forgot about the 6 feet rule. But like I said before great food and friendly staff. Recommendations to the restaurant please where Mask, Gloves and stick to the six foot distance.

Cute place with tasty food and friendly service! A friend and I spent a couple hours here during breakfast. Our server was nice and polite, keeping my coffee filled and offering suggestions on breakfast starters. We ordered the vegetable scrambled eggs and the Golden Gate omelette. Both of these places came with fruit, a biscuit and this hash brown thing (or grits). Portions were good! I was able to take half my omelette to-go! I would definitely come back to try their waffles or French toast. Also free parking in the parking garage not too far from the restaurant. Quick service, clean restaurant.

It was fairly busy when we arrived at about 10am on a Saturday. However, our wait was under 15 minutes. I noticed that the place looked clean, bright and family friendly. I started off with a good and refreshing mimosa followed by a delicious Philly scramble with perfectly seasoned slices of prime rib and sauteed mushrooms. The side biscuit had a nice outside crunch, and was soft and warm on the inside. Also, the hashbrown casserole was creamy and delicious. I must add that our server, Stephanie, was amazing which enhanced our overall experience.

****Wonderful Experience*****
My family and I were greeted at the front door by one of the mangers named Hector. Hector thank you so much for the warm greeting it makes such a difference. Our servers were David, Angie, and Laura. Our order came out correct, hot, and prompt. I appreciate all you checking in on us to make sure everything was ok. We will definitely be back. The food was delicious. They also have BIG texas size pancakes. Our visit exceeded all of our expectations💕 P.s. Once we were served the whole table went quiet and smiles came out!  Thank you for delivering great customer service.

name: Potbelly Sandwich Shop
address: 1815 S Texas 6, Sugar Land, TX 77478, USA
reviews: I didn't realize Potbelly opened so early! They have breakfast items, but I opted for the Veggie Melt. So good! The restaurant was very clean, well stocked and the employee was courteous and made an awesome sandwich. I love Potbelly!

I took a trip to PotBelly recently and I was pleased with my experience yet again.  This place is always consistent delivering scrumptious sandwiches and soups!  

My turkey club sandwich and cup of chicken tortilla soup was fantastic and a perfect treat on a cold day in Sugar Land.  The service is always so quick, even when they look busy.  My soup and sandwich were delicious and ALWAYS so tasty!  Love this place!

Nice people, clean place, good old wooden environment. Just like the cowboy days. Good music. Last but not least, good sandwiches. As this place is close to my workplace, I just go there about every other week. Their shakes are pretty good.
We had a HUGE order of boxed lunches placed ahead online for our group.  Everything was ready to go when we arrived and super fresh!  Thanks Potbelly team!!
The sandwiches were pretty good and a decent size.

name: The Sweet Boutique Bakery
address: 2270 Lone Star Dr, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: My wife and I chose the Sweet Boutique as the baker of our wedding cake (02/02/2020) after a disaster between us and other original baker. They were kind and patient and help us out in a bind since we were running out of time before our wedding. However, they pulled off an exquisite geod cake that we always wanted and it was clear we should have chosen them from the start. The cake layers and sheet cake were moist and held up very nicely. Their coconut cake and passion fruit filling was to die for, lemon cake and strawberry filling was the perfect amount of tart and sweet, chocolate cake and ganche was a perfect combo, and almond cake and amaretto was so much better than we could have anticipated. Everything was perfect and we cannot thank Christine, Martin, and their team enough for making it all work for us. It is simply unbelievable that she was self-taught and can't wait to see her compete in the Spring Baking show on the Food Network.

I absolutely love all their cakes! I got my wedding cake here and have lloved their variety ever since! I get all my cakes from here! Every time we do a family party or special event we know where the cakes will be from! I especially love that they are light and fluffy and just the right amount of sweet! I took these two cakes two hours away to a town called Palacios and they always arrive perfect which is always amazing to me. Just love love love this bakery!

After seeing these on Insta, I had to try them! I don't like donuts but I sure love mochi. 

1/2 Dozen Mochi Donuts $20

Mochi Donut Flavors: Matcha, Blueberry, Strawberry, Nutella, Mango Cream, Pistachio Rose

My intial reactions after one bite each:

strawberry - frosting was too sweet but yumm, chewy texture

bluberry - pretty good, mochi custard, yummy, will get this again

matcha - Mmm chocolate base and very deep matcha flavor, so gooood!! must try

mango cream - wow the mango cream on top is really mangomango, tastes so delicious

nutella- chocolate nutella taste, nothing special, not really chewy either

rose pistachio - rose taste, kinda bland, looks cute though

I was lucky because today they had on the same day pickup, I ordered at 10am and was able to pick up at 11am! Located in Sugarland Town Square, a lot of parking spaces. 

When the weather is hot outside, 80F, on the way back home (ex 20min drive) the cream on top might melt and be sticky. 

I liked how these are not too thick and thin, perfect sized. Would I get this again? probably like a gift for friends :) It's super cute and if I do go again I want to try other flavors. Overall I think my drive was pretty worth it!
I pretty much get cupcakes and cake pops once a  week lol. Always fresh never dry! Red velvet and tiramisu has to be my favorites hands down. Definitely my go-to spot in Sugarland.

I came in for dessert after dining nearby, and I got a cupcake to go, in the hopes that I could sneakily eat on the way home out of the grasp of my toddler monster's tiny arms in the backseat. 

I open the box in the car to find a Chinese finger trap, designed to keep the cupcake secure enough to send through the mail. I needed both hands to free the treat, much to my dismay, as I'd intended on using at least one hand to drive. 

I'm a lady. One way around this overwhelming dilemma would be to do the unthinkable and go icing first. You just don't go icing first. Eventually I won against the overpriced sugar bomb and stuffed it into my mouth, as a lady would. 

Four stars.

name: Starbucks
address: 16098 City Walk, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: A favorite spot for me since the opening.  It's a nice place to sit and sip while people watching.  Everyone is about their business but nice and receptive. The baristas are the best!

two people ring up while one person makes the drinks? Really? Could not get our names correct. Used my stars instead of a coupon I clearly asked them to redeem. Had to spend 20 min with customer service to get my points back. Get your act together folks....

Normally head here on a Saturday morning in my running shoes, and work out gear to hang out with the other fakers. Ha!

Always a nice welcome.  Selection is good and the English Breakfast Tea is almost as good as the tea we make at home.
always a great coffee and tea spot to visit...
Very friendly! Got our order quickly. Asked for extra small cup for my friend, to hold her drink better. Instant service. Thanks!

name: BJ's Restaurant & Brewhouse
address: 2231 Hwy 6, Sugar Land, TX 77478, USA
reviews: My family went to this location to celebrate a birthday and it was a very disappointing experience. We were a party of 12 and were sat at two different tables because supposedly it was going to be so busy and we would be taking up too much room to put the tables together. We ordered drinks and appetizers which came out in a decent amount of time. Once we ordered our entrees, that's when things kind of fell apart. There were such long periods of time were our waiter didn't come to refill drinks. Once our entrees finally arrived, one of them was cool to the touch and we were told it was because they were trying to time them to come out together, but we were still missing an entree that didn't come out for another 20 min. After such a long time of no refills, two of our party took some of our glasses up to the bar themselves to get refills. The waiter never acknowledged the drinks again after that. Every part of this experience took way longer than it should have. We were there for 3 hours. Oh, and they never sat anyone else in the section where we were told we would have taken up too much room. It was empty the whole time we were there. After all of this, the waiter had the arrogance to tell me if I had any questions about tipping, the suggested tip amounts were at the bottom of the bill, and repeated his name in case we wanted to ask for him again. This makes sense if your customers are having a great experience, but it was pretty obvious that none of us were. So I'm not sure if he was being sincere or ironic. Either way, I will not be returning to this location or recommend it to others.

Starting with the servers. The one that took our order was so energetic and had a good vibe. He even tried to make a drink that wasn’t even in the menu (it came out good). The food came out super quick. But man, the food was so flavorful! At the end of our visit, he treated our table with anything we needed like boxes or drinks to go. I would definitely come back!

Had a burger, fries and a glass of wine here at the bar on NYE while solo after a comedy show nearby.  It was very tasty.  Stephan waited on me.  Very attentive and we toasted on midnight.  Staff person made Hennessy cupcakes which were delicious and appreciated!

We had our company gathering at this location and everyone had a great time. The food was served buffet style. Everything was delicious. Not one complaint! Servers went above and beyond to ensure everyone was satisfied and happy. Would definitely recommend this location for a company outing!
Food was pretty average. They have a wide selection of beers. Their pizookie dessert is really good. It's a freshly baked chocolate chip cookie with a few scoops of ice cream.

name: The Rouxpour - Sugar Land
address: 2298 Texas Dr, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: A little noisy. Not my favorite food but my friend loved it. Some people have different tastes so I think most people would like this restaurant. Again a little loud but good quality restaurant. My friend got to meet the owner he was excellent. I think you'll enjoy it

My visit was worth a positive review because of the remarkable service we received. We had arrived a few minutes before happy hour would end. And because our server came by quickly, we were able to put in orders for drinks and appetizers. I really enjoyed the Mexican martini which just seemed to have been perfectly made. The stuffed shrimp rouxpour was delicious as well. Everyone at the table had positive feedback about their meals and service.

5 STARS.  Marlin, the General Manager - AMAZING.  The food, the service, the Management  OUTSTANDING!!.  He is very professional and in speaking with him he takes great pride in what he does.  He brought to my attention a possible food allergy reaction in which he rectified promptly.  With that said, spoke volumes about this restaurant.  Marlin, thank you!!
A good place to grab some really good cajun food whenever you're in Town Square. They have great lunch specials, and the service is always nice.

This is one of my top 5 restaurants to go for brunch on a Saturday or Sunday. The atmosphere is amazing, the staff is friendly, the food is delicious and the live band gives off such a positive vibe. I would recommend to anyone!

name: Baker St. Pub & Grill
address: 15970 City Walk, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: I've been here many times over the last 10ish years and it's exactly what you'd expect from a British-style pub. I think the food is above average and the drinks are priced well. There are a good selection of pub games. What sets baker Street apart for me is the generous specials and variety of seating. Great crowd almost all the time

It's a pretty cool place too meet up with friends. They have multiple TVs if you are trying to watch the game. The main focus is more or less the bar. They have a long happy hour, but the drinks are pretty weak in my opinion. Considering that it's a Pub I won't be too critical as I don't drink beer. The food was decent and the service wasn't bad.

Distinctly British atmosphere that lacks distinctly British menu. Baker St. hit the nail on the head in regards to the look and feel of a British pub, but with a dinner menu that only has two British dishes, shepherds pie and fish and chips, it unfortunately really misses the mark. Most of the menu is regular old bar food and Mexican foods, which really didn't make sense. 

The food was somewhere between okay and good, service was slow due to our server being the only server working during Sunday brunch hours (not his fault, but it took forever). Fish and chips was 15 dollars for 2 pieces of fish, a half order was 10 dollars.

Bottom line: I won't be back due to the menu not matching up with my expectations, fairly expensive for what we got in both amount and quality.

Would have been 1 star if it wasn't for a nice bartender and a cool couple at the  bar. Between problems with the draft system making a good beer impossible to a 45:min  wait for a dinner salad. That was sitting in water in the bowl. It was sad

Baker St. Pub & Grill serves up English classics like fish and chips with a side of beer. They usually have live music performances. The design of the restaurant adds to the atmosphere of actually being in a pub. The food is good and service is not bad. During the week it is a bit quiet so try going either at night or on the weekend. I do not usually go here when I am in Town Square, but it is fine.

name: Japaneiro's
address: 2168 Texas Dr, Sugar Land, TX 77478, USA
reviews: The food, drinks are fantastic here, this review is the for service received last night. My husband I have been going here for years, it’s a favorite. We always sit at the bar and have our favorite, the Shaggy Dog, and an assortment of sushi. We’ve always had outstanding bartender service. Last night Steven styli our drink and food order. We were promptly delivered our drinks. We ordered another round just before 6 to receive the happy hour price. Usually the bartender correctly understands he will charge it, then pour when we have finished our first drink.. he poured right away and drinks sat there getting warm.. but no biggie. A half an hour goes by, and people that came sat down and ordered after us, were receiving their food. We asked Steven to check on our meal. He comes right back with it and said “ you ask, you receive”. Really ?! No apology for it sitting there and WE had to ask?!

Very delicious and reliable restaurant in the heart of Sugar Land town center! The Mexican  Japanese fusion is so unique in style and taste! Anyone looking to try sushi but is worried about taste or flavor should definitely try this place. I've been coming here for years and have tried a little bit of everything. 

Parking can be found right behind the restaurant in the parking garage. 

Had the volcano sushi and shaggy dog. For appetizer it was Jalapeno cream cheese. Dessert for "heart attack" (warm cinnamon roll-type cake with ice cream) - definitely try this!

the food is good, but it’s gone downhill quality wise over the years. it doesn’t taste as fresh. nonetheless there’s still Japaneiro’s go-to appetizers, like the crab puffs, dumplings, or spicy garlic edamame- and of course the shaggy dog is a great original. I really like other rolls as well. biggest thing is that the service can be slow and the food is pricey unless you do their amazing lunch special deal on weekdays
Awesome atmosphere, professional hostesses who handled the waiting crowd well... Shout out to Chris at the bar!!! 🤗🍹  Delicious food, can't wait to return! 😋🤸🏾‍♀️👍🏾

I've frequented this establishment for 4+ years and the quality has never disappointed. The sushi rolls are done with a finesse; their by the piece is fresh and melts in the mouth. The staff have always been amazing so it goes to show they really know how to employ the right people for their atmosphere. I decided to go for my birthday a couple of days ago and they really made it special with flawless service, cuisine and a personal touch of amazing for the candle lit dessert they presented me. I strongly recommend this place for any occasion from a quick stop in to a group gathering/celebration. If you love fresh ingredients, delicious drinks(non/alcoholic ), stunning service then this is definitely a place you should check out for yourself.

name: The Honey Baked Ham Company
address: 2637 Town Center Blvd N, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: No gloves, no masks, and no sandwiches, but they will have signs everywhere reminding you that YOU should not be touching anything, maintaining social distancing, and otherwise being a good and loyal subject.
HBH Company has Holiday pick up down to a science,  eady in a fast moving line and out. Their ham is awesome my family just loves them.

Olivia was extremely helpful! She was polite, professional, and knowledgeable. I will definitely be coming back. 
P.S.
(They don't serve chicken)
Love me some honey baked ham. Their smoked Turkey is the bomb!  Best I've ever had. The sided are great too.
The ham was good but the turkey was overcooked and dry.  They now offer other things aside from just the main meats. It's worth a trip to check it out.

name: Benihana
address: 2579 Town Center Blvd N, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews:
Benihana has been a place for personal celebrations for years. We went this time "just because", but that didn't diminish the experience at all.
.
All the regular things were still great. The show was fun, if a bit campy by now. The waitress was super attentive at the right times. The food was terrific; I'd actually forgotten how much I enjoy Benihana dishes.
.
My wife added scallops, which were perfectly cooked and absolutely delicious. I had the trio, and while the shrimp were fine, they didn't add much for me; I'll skip then next time.
 .
Overall, this is hard to beat for a weeknight special night out, or "just because".
Interesting restaurant where you can enjoy the cooking time. This is kind of Japanese's style restaurant. And the food is so good. Drinks is also impressive.

The food was mediocre. Too salty. Their soup was delicious. Good chef comes and makes the food on table. It was busy and took time for food to come out. Not a bad experience, the service was good and the chef was entertaining.

Just hope you do not have birthday coupon to redeem or that when you go there is no one there. Went with my wife to celebrate her birthday, as this was her favorite restaurant, and we planned on redeeming the coupon that Benihana sends for birthdays. Wife and I share a plate but always order a ton of appetizers and extras(extra steak and lobster, etc) so that way we can meet the coupon requirements. First, the manager comes out and says “I’m not sure if you read the coupon or not but you need to purchase two entrees”. The coupon does not say that. Next, since we were the only two guests at the time of dining, the chef “Tom” was rude, cooked the food poorly and just looked mad the entire time he has to cook for only two people. It’s not the consumers fault the restaurant is not busy. In addition, he is asking about the coupon requirements himself. I understand the manager asking, despite how he asked, but now even the chef. We came here all the time but how they treat people when it comes to birthdays and discounts sent by the company itself is ridiculous. The waiter was the only saving grace for the experience but it’s a shame that special days are handled in this manner and that consumers are treated differently at different time of the day and level of how many people are there. The place has gradually lost its customer service and respect over the years.

Went here for an early dinner on Memorial Day with my mom and sisters and we enjoyed it very much.  We had made reservations but didn’t really need them as it was pretty empty at 4pm, were seated as soon as we walked in.  We were all dressed pretty casually and didn't feel out of place.  I got the filet mignon and lobster tail, both were cooked very nicely.  Presentation was good, service was good, place was clean, nice atmosphere, overall it was a great dinner.  No complaints. 👍🏻🤗

name: Guru Burgers Crepes
address: 2268 Texas Dr, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: Excellent variety of delicious burgers and various types of fries. Good service. Regular, vegetarian and gluten-free options. The only reason I gave this four stars instead of five is because the crepes were really tough and dry, although the flavor was nice. I would definitely go back though.

Me and my family tried Guru for the first time about a week ago. We ordered takeout and it was awesome!! I got the king burger because I love peanut butter and it was epic!! My wife got the Pancho burger and she loved it!! We will definitely be eating here again.
Haven’t been here in about four years. One word comes to mind. Consistent. Still the same great place I remember. Quality food and thoughtful beer selection. Highly recommend. Keep up the great work.

Wonderful lunch!!! The burger was super fresh and delicious!! The beet chips are great and a welcome addition for a side dish. The crepe was yummy and full of veggies. The whole experience was great and the staff was super friendly.

We’ve been here twice now. Pretty good selection. I found the food is rather very good for the most part. I love that you can get a slider size burger as I can only eat half a full size one generally. Overall, they have good options, but there’s something about it that keeps it from being really great. 

The vibe is laid back and comfortable. They have a small patio that’s covered and fills up first on nice days. 

Overall, it’s an enjoyable experience for burgers and fries. The crepe I tried was meh though.

name: Boston Market
address: 2410 Hwy 6, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews:
The  food and service is VERY good! The food tastes great!

 However, I  washed my hands in the restroom.  It was like as if I walked into a gas station restroom (not buc-ees). The sink and toilets were really dirty.

I gave a 4☆ because of the restroom.

Came in here on a cold Monday after a long day at work looking for some comfort food. Jordan and Victoria were SO kind and thoughtful. They actually chat with you and make you feel welcome. I really appreciated their outstanding service, and the food was tasty. A great visit. 😃

I was craving their sweet potato casserole so I stopped for dinner. Great customer service.  They were busy but seemed to be keeping up with cleaning the tables, etc. I'm vegetarian now so I haven't ate here much lately.  I ordered a veggie plate this time. Good food for a good price.
The food is amazing! Just felt like it could have been cleaner, specifically the rr. But over all good place.

Buddy of mine told me about this place, Never had the chance to try, finally got there and tried the chicken, it was the most delicious chicken i ever had at Houston.
Highly recommended.

name: Flying Saucer Draught Emporium
address: 15929 City Walk, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: Love that they are pet friendly just expect fruit flies out in the patio. Good daily specials. Enjoyed the fried pickles so much I forgot to take the pic to post.
Great beer selection. They have 4 dollar beer specials everyday which is good. I just wish they have more flavor options for the wings. How about honey bbq, lemon pepper  etc.

Very cool place. Nice patio area. Lots and lots of beers to choose from. Good bar food. Try the tater tots. Very near a free parking garage. A good place for a date just don’t except it to be quiet inside.
Great place, wow ambience and adorable gentry! Huge collection of beer of all types with delicious food. Wish they could add to their wines collection which is surprisingly very limited

The saucer burger is one of my favorite items here. Plus, the have non-alcoholic beer options. The staff is always friendly and always prompt. The quality of food is always high and made fresh. I always look forward to coming back here.

name: Carrabba's Italian Grill
address: 2335 Hwy 6, Sugar Land, TX 77478, USA
reviews: Food was great. Service was exceptional. Wonderful ambiance. It had been several years since my last visit and I was not disappointed. Food portions are exceedingly generous. Be prepared to take home your doggy bag.

I'm new here, but this place made me feel like family.
The service is polite, happy, informative and clean.
It's like nothing in the world is more important than your satisfaction.
The food, though, is the reason you'll come back. Authentic, hand made, in house recipes that will bring you back to try something new.
Great place to eat!

Overall a good experience. The food is tasty and the portions are large. The server was helpful and the service was prompt. My only problem was with a credit I had earned when doing a previous large catering order. It was two 25 dollar credits only good in July. I asked if I could use them both and was told no. I was not jazzed about that but understood. I was also told that I could not use my cards if anyone ordered a special on the menu. With 4 people ordering it was embarrassing to tell them not to order a special. To me that is being pretty nit picky. If you reward a large catering order with a discount let them use it... Don't split hairs.

Their food and service are both very good. There was a mistake with my order and the waiter was quick to fix it and even gave me a new plate. The quality of food is amazing. Even a simple plate like spaghetti was wonderful and very fresh tasting. The pork fish was also very flavorful and yummy. The desserts were very good, especially the apple one. We’re never going to Olive Garden again! For a few dollars extra you can get delicious Italian food that is much better quality.

A relaxing environment with fantastic food and service. We were able to have conversations without yelling. The food came out fairly fast and was delicious. The waitress was attentive to my food allergies too. That's always a big plus for me. It's now our go-to place when we want to have time together without a kiddo.

name: Turquoise Grill & Bar
address: 16019 City Walk, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews: This place used to be amazing but quality and service have gone down. The previous owner was a fantastic host but new management is underwhelming. The food has good flavor but not up to the previous standard. Its a shame because it was one of my top ten places to eat.

I ate a trio of appetizers: tabouleh, stuffed grape leaves and hummus, accompanied with tasty pita bread. All of the ingredients were noticeably fresh and carefully prepared. The waitstaff were so friendly! They even gave me complimentary baklava as I was paying my check. Really sweet people! I’m impressed!

I cannot say the best Turkish food in town as a Turkish Houston local guide. Location is OK, atmosphere as well but food must be improved. There are other Turkish restaurants in town that you may pay less price for more quality.

If I could give no star I would... I regretted taking my boyfriend there on his birthday. We wanted to do something different so drove from San Antonio to have great Turkish food in a place I thought was the best. I told him Turquoise Grill has great ambiance and great food. I was very very wrong. 
The place was empty, the food was bad, the service was  careless, nonchalant,  and rude (I asked a question to the waiter - in English-  he looked at me like I was from an outer space and walked away without even acknowledging me). 
It is a shame that the hired band members were friendlier than the in house staff. I will neither recommend not ever go to that place again...

We went on the last day of Houston Restaurant Week. Turquoise Grill is in the heart of Sugar Land's Town Center, just down from City Hall. 

As we walked over, a line of people were posing on the front steps of City Hall. It must have been a human art display because it was dark when we walked back and they were all sitting with heads down in the same spots. 

A lot of the shops were closed for Labor Day, but the restaurant had several tables of customers on the sidewalk patio. We chose to eat inside.

It's a pretty little restaurant. We hadn't been here in a while. Glad we came. My husband had the shrimp-topped Scottish Salmon with shrimp cocktail as appetizer and rice pudding for dessert. His salmon was perfectly grilled and the best I've tasted in years! The cocktail had five big, tender shrimp. The cinnamon-dusted rice pudding was fine, but would have looked nicer served in a little glass or ceramic bowl rather than a styrofoam cup.   

My choice was the sampler appetizer, grilled lamb chops and baklava. I have to say that it was really, really good!

Hummus + falafel + quinoa tomatoes + baba ghanoush + dolmades + pita bread = happiness! I could have stopped eating after this platter and been fine. The smokiness of the baba ghanoush was wonderful.

The medium grilled lamb chops are pink inside and so tasty! There was plenty of mashed potatoes and just enough grilled vegetables. The only issue I had was that the baklava wasn't as light and crispy as I've had. It was a flat-ish healthy version, with no honey drizzle on top. 

Overall, the exceptional entrees and my Mediterranean sampler made for a memorable dinner.

name: Lupe Tortilla
address: 15801 Southwest Fwy, Sugar Land, TX 77478, USA
reviews: Went out with my wife and son and some close friends. It had been a while since we been to Lupe and we were not disappointed!! The food was yummy, the service was great and we really enjoyed our time there. I had the fish tacos and they were amazing!! My wife had a fish dish as well and my son had the enchiladas. Whatever you get here you can't go wrong!!

Great Tex Mex option. Loved the ambience and the food. We got chips to start with and the salsa was spicy! I Loved it!

They have plenty of vegetarian options. Ask for the vegetarian menu, they have a separate menu for that. The original menu doesnt have a lot of vegetation options in it. We got the grilled mushrooms Lupe and puffy tacos. The Lupe was amazing, never tried something like that before. Their beans has great flavor and is not bland like other Mexican places do. They added corn and tomatoes to it which I think enhanced the taste. 

The  puffy tacos were huge and not your typical taco size. They had a lot of cheese in it and we loved it!

5 stars goes to our server. Me and my wife won’t ever  forget his name it’s like chevron but with a D we know because he made that joke. We have been coming to this location for years and we always get a pound a fajitas but this sever made sure to tell us that the beans and flour tortillas where made with lard. WE DO NOT EAT PORK. So for years we have been eating lard not knowing so a very big thank you goes to Chevron but with a D. Not to mention he is very good at making sure we were well taken care of. If your in the area on the Saturday or Sunday evening ask for Devron he’s one of the best there.. He gets all 5 stars!!!

We went there for dinner early on a Saturday evening with friends and we had 4 kids ranging from 1 year till 4.5 year old with us. Most of the place was empty when we were seated. It took a long time for our server to come and take the drinks order and longer for him to bring the drinks out. Once we ordered our food (it was hard to flag down our server and took really long to place the food order) it took very long for the food to come out and then also they got the order wrong. I am gald they gave us a table next to the patio as half of the time we were outside entertaining the kids while waiting for the food. The food was very delicious and the cocktails were good. The problem was the service - it was very very slow even when the restaurant was not full to begin with. Had they taken the order early on I bet we would have enjoyed the food and the place lot more. Kids would have been in much better mood as well. Would like to visit again and hopefully the service will be better then.
Always enjoy Lupe Tortillas. Great atmosphere. Good bar. Outdoor seating. Good food. Friendly service. Reasonable prices. I tried a new dish with an egg and enchiladas.

name: Chipotle Mexican Grill
address: 2280 Lone Star Dr, Sugar Land, TX 77479, USA
reviews:
•Decent food
•Decent employees
•Sometimes thé music can be loud on 
  occasions... but most of the time it’s fine.
•Serving size of rise has been not as much as it 
   use to be... wish you guys could give a little 
   more rice in the bowls ;)

Other than that.... 4/5 rating 🐄

Service is very quick,the menu is limited but tastes good.I usually order the bowl with the clianto rice and steak .
It's a clean and warm space.
You can decide to eat outside in the patio.

I love coming to this location for lunch! Not only are you guaranteed a delicious, healthy, and satisfying meal but you're always greeted with a smile as soon as you walk in the door. The staff really takes care of you and goes above and beyond when a customer needs it. One time I dropped my entire bowl on accident and the staff was quick to reassure me that everything was fine - didn't even make a big deal about it, cleaned up the mess on the spot and hooked me up with a brand new bowl just the way I had ordered it. I really can't praise them enough, thanks guys! Five stars all the way!!
Quick service.  Staff is kind. Food is good.

Took 2 veggie bowls with tortillas.
When making the bowl we asked the guy to put everything veggie only.
When we were paying, we were charged extra for the Quesso in the bowl.
Person making the bowl should have notified us before putting it as least. If nothing else they should have sign on the Quesso container that would tell the customer it is not included in the standard pricing for the bowl.
Also we were charged for the tortillas which were suppose to be included.

name: Red Lobster
address: 2323 Hwy 6, Sugar Land, TX 77478, USA
reviews: I've been here several times. Most of the time it's been great. Food was delicious. I've had a good experience with most of the servers. Ismael was especially nice and attentive. I've seen 2 managers so far, they were both very nice. I love the prices and items for the kid's meals. I also love the lunch specials. I highly recommend this place.

The service was good, food was no good. The first and last time I will visit a Red Lobster. I was really looking forward to it as I'm from a different country and had always heard people talking about Red Lobster. If they opened a store in my home country, they wouldn't even last a week.
